reviewText: I was one of the actors in this flim and it was a great experience the cast was great. I love working and learning from the director. Just order the movie and you will learn so much about Beale I know I did Thanks Carolyn for the opportunity. Much love

WOW!!! after viewing this film it was amazing how accurate it is on top of being entertaining. If you want to get an idea of how Beale Street was and the people that helped shape it this the film to see. pick it up and check it out.

Please Believe the HYPE, This movie is everything you've read / heard about and more. I was fortunate to play a small role as a waitress which was absolutely Incredible!!! This is the most exciting and entertaining movie that i have seen in a while. It is a phenomenal movie with Unknown ACTORS who were ABSOLUTELY AWESOME, full of energy and excitement.... you would've thought they were straight out of HOLLYWOOD!!  This movie is a MUST see,  It is such a historical Movie about Beale Street, the Birthplace of the Blues. Proud to be a Memphian!!  I am so Proud of Ms. Yancy for  HER OUTSTANDING DIRECTING:  JOB WELL DONE!!
Congratulations:
Ms. CAROLYN YANCY GUNN

If you really want to see the true beginning of music, you need to order this DVD.  The actors were amazing ! You will get an opportunity to see the actors in action which brought back memories of the great legendary musicians that are no longer with us physically.  But, their legacy lives on forever!

Priscilla Telesford

I was honored to be an extra in Take Me Back to Beale!
Carolyn Yancy did a wonderful job !  The actors were cast perfectly.
The history and story of W.C. Handy was so informative and entertaining.

I highly recommend this movie to everyone.
This movie captures a part of history that made Memphis famous!

Get your DVD  and you will have a treasure to enjoy and to share in your family heirloom.

Sybil Marie Presley

This Docu-drama is awesome for history and music buffs, in that you get the Blues and Jazz musical history of Beale Street,the Birthplace of the Blues, factually presented, but in an entertaining movie format. I particularly like the music of W.C. Handy and the details about his life that are featured in this movie. Also, the music of Memphis Minnie, Louie Armstrong, Ma' Rainey and the great Bessie Smith is so entertaining. As a school teacher, I can say that this movie would be an entertaining and informative teaching tool for history and English teachers.
